title: 7-year-old boy among 4 shot in drive-by shooting on Daisy Street
content:
A 7-year-old boy was among four shot in a drive-by shooting Sunday night in the 2300 block of Daisy Street, according to a press release from the Chattanooga Police Department.
Two juveniles and two adults were shot. The injuries are serious but not believed to be life-threatening, according to the release.
The two adults were identified as Shaderrika Ruffin, 19, and Charles Patton Jr., 34. Patton was shot in the right foot, and Ruffin was grazed in the arm, according to the release.
Ruffin was treated on scene while the other three victims were taken to a local hospital with a personal vehicle. The 7-year-old boy was shot in the back, according to the release, and a 15-year-old was shot in the left foot.
There is no information about the suspect at this time.
Chattanooga Police ask anyone with information regarding this incident to call 423-698-2525.
